data.title: Great location, friendly staff
data.text: Went here for a business meeting. The entrance was hard to find (stairway is within another restaurant), but its setting on top of the building is quite nice. The food I ordered was good, but not amazing. As an appetizer, I got the nachos. The homemade potato chips were fantastic, but I'm not a fan of the Velveeta-like consistency of the cheese.

data.title: Outdoor Fireplace, Upscale Cuisine
data.text:
The eggroll is stunning -- tastes better than you might expect. And the fish and chips were better than Merry Ol' England (and I've had it there too.)

Don't wait, run to this sports bar for inside or outside dining with a pleasant experience from the kitchen

data.title: Unique setting, good food/beer selections
data.text: Visited with another couple & had a nice dinner. The menu's not huge but you'll find something. Many craft beers on tap - a hit with our table! For non beer drinkers there's a full bar selection.

data.title: Absolutely perfect.
data.text: This place has some of the best beef I've ever had. I can't believe that I have not heard of this place. Outdoor balcony seating. Big screens, and 100% perfect beef. I suggest the nachos.

data.title: Atmosphere nice - Food terrible
data.text: We have been here several times.  Each time we experience something different.  When it first opened, it was great.  As the years have gone, the food quality has gone too.  I came up the elevator and can't tell you have filthy dirty that back area is.  Knowing it is a public elevator, one would think the restaurant manager/owner would be more cognizant of the appearance of his back area.  The food has been cold when very few people have been in the restaurant.  Love the atmosphere, but not the food.

data.title: Horrible Food
data.text: Although this place has a huge beer selection ( none of us were liquor drinkers) the food was awful. We all ordered fish and chips   The cod was good however the batter was so thick that it ruined the taste. We all removed the coating which didn't leave much to eat. The Coke slaw was ok however the squished peas were ghastly. The menu was extremely limited - this is not a place to go to it!

data.title: Great Beer List - Awesome View
data.text: love sitting outside without being right next to the cars on Main Street. I've only ever had drinks, so can't speak for the food.

data.title: Poor Food.
data.text: I ordered fish & chips, the overall quality of the food was poor. The fish which was of a low quality was over battered, leaving the batter undercooked and very greasy. The chips tasted old soggy and greasy. The so called "mushy peas" did not resemble the ones found in a typical British restaurant. This was definitely a bad rendition of British food and I doubt that the proprietor or the chef has ever set foot in the UK.

data.title: $2 Drafts on Mondays
data.text: Have been here twice now.  Found out on Monday there are $2 drafts, so that was awesome.  Large beer menu, bottled and draft.  The Shepard's pie is actually made with lamb, which seems to be incredibly difficult to find, and it is excellent.  Have had both the cheese and duck poutine, was very happy with both.  Nice outdoor space that I haven't yet been able to use since it was raining both times I went.

data.title: It's a Craft Beer place not a restaurant
data.text: Been to the place twice. First time I sat at the bar and had the fish and chips and a couple beers, not bad. Went back this past Friday, 2 of sat at a table. Looked over the one sided page limited food menu and the 2 sided craft beer menu. I ordered a Jack and 7. That was a mistake, hardly had any jack in it. It's a beer place order a beer, they can't make a good drink. Had the duck sausage. They were served in hard hotdog buns. Hardly could taste the very small sausage in the hard bun. Tasted and looked as if they were made days ago and warmed up in the micro wave. The other order was the fish and chips which was ok. DON'T GO HERE FOR THE FOOD GO FOR THE BEER! Good bar and roof top patio.

data.title: English Pub??? I must have missed it ..
data.text: I tried them for the first time in May.  I live minutes away and never tried them so for a treat I thought I would go.  I was expecting some unique and amazing food dishes that I could not get anywhere else in royal oak.  I was sadly disappointed to see most of the items on the menu I could get elsewhere in the city.  I did love the poutine that I had but was expecting more authentic English pub food.  They have a small selection to choose from and most of it is american cuisine it an added topping. If you like beer this is the place to go.  If you are a foodie well try it once but do not be shocked if it is a disappointment.  also just because you put a British flag on a window does not make the place British.   This is a result of having the same owner as Cantina Diablo ..  a company should focus on one style food and make it the best instead of trying to be money hungry and dip into other ventures that are not the best or the same old stuff different name.

data.title: Nice tavern to socialize in.
data.text: We went for Fish and Chips on Good Friday.  Very good fish and chips with Generous portions.  Comfortable relaxed atmosphere.  Nothing fancy, but a nice evening.  Prompt and friendly service.  Manager even came over to ask how we enjoyed dinner.  We will be back again!

data.title: Quality of Experience may be Season-Dependent
data.text:
My wife and I have visited Red Fox twice recently and don't plan to return (with one exception, noted below.).  None of the four different meals we ordered between us was particularly thrilling, although the quantity was ample in case you measure satisfaction by bulk.  In fact, the reason we went back the second time was to give the menu a second chance since we weren't all that impressed the first time.

The beer selection is very good, however, and that was a highlight of our experiences.  Unfortunately for the Red Fox, however, an increasing number of establishments feature expansive beer lists, e.g., the "B-Spot" just down the street, so having an impressive selection is no longer a sufficient condition for success.

I imagine we would have liked this place much more had our visit been in nicer weather when the doors could be open and we might even be able to sit outdoors.  (For that matter, maybe we will try it one more time next summer, if for the atmosphere and beer if nothing else.)  But those same glass doors provide poor insulation and the place tends to be chilly during the winter.

Oh, and the place isn't particularly British in feel despite the presence of the de rigeuer Fish and Chips on the menu.

My advice:  If you're a beer enthusiast, then check the place out in nice weather for a brew.  Don't expect a great meal, although it probably will be large in any case.

data.title: Not very good
data.text: The cocktail pours are very small and the food and service poor.  Great location so hopefully it closes and gets rebranded.

data.title: On the Roof
data.text: We treated our niece to dinner on a beautiful August night.  It was wonderfully breezy and the roof was wonderful.  We had a great meal with wonderful craft beer.  The waitress was pleasant and swift.

data.title: Beware---Menu Changes
data.text: We've been here many times, one of our favorite summer venues.  It's top attraction is that it's a rooftop restaurant with wonderful patio, complete with fire pits and casual seating areas.  Large selection of tap beers from all over the world.  Some of our favorite foods were French Onion Soup Dumplings, the fresh potato crisps with blue cheese & bacon bits, and they had particular meat specials certain days.  Saturday was Short Ribs in several dishes, such as their artisan grilled cheese with short ribs, or short rib dinner.  They also had a nice Roast Beef with Yorkshire pudding.  A favorite side was the very skinny shoestring fries---delicious!  All these dishes----GONE!  A new menu was unveiled last week.  Many of our favorite tap beers (Atwater Vanilla Java Porter & Speckled Hen---GONE.  Our waitress said they still had as many kinds of beer on tap as previously, but we would swear this was not true.  We have had many food mis-haps here from the kitchen as well, oops, they dropped it, they over-cooked it and it's being re-made.  We waited 50 minutes on this occasion to get our food.  Our service was good and also friendly, but there are too many other dependably good choices in Royal Oak or nearby Ferndale for a very good meal.  The view alone is not worth it.  Unless they just want you to hang out on the terrace & drink, then go down the street to eat.  There were many, many, empty tables inside on what should have been a busy Saturday evening on a beautiful day.  Disappointed & probably will dine elsewhere.  Incidentally; our server told us the shoestring fries were still available at their other restaurant downstairs.  The Mexican restaurant?  Huh?

data.title: Nice atmosphere, good service, good food
data.text: My husband and I ate here last night per the review of our sitter an except for the climb up to the restaurant via the staircase, we were very happy with our experience.  Our server, John, was great with suggestions and service.  I ordered the broiled whitefish with mashed potatoes and sauteed spinach and got a Woodward salad on the side that came with a tomato dressing.  I thoroughly enjoyed my food.  My husband ordered their Shepherd's pie which came with balsamic glazed roasted brussel sprouts.  His was also very good. The only downside was that it felt cold inside (temperature, not atmosphere) and one of the employees opened the doors right by us (even after I asked her to sit us somewhere warm) to go outside despite the fact that it was maybe 40 degrees outside and nobody was outside.  Had a hard time warming back up after that.  But, I'd go back again for a date night if I'm in Royal Oak.

data.title: Great Roof-Top Bar
data.text:
I have been here a few times in He last few months. The food is pretty good/decent, but the atmosphere is better! My friend had his going away party here. There were about 15 of us there, spread out in two adjacent areas. The service was very consistent and prompt throughout the night.

I'd say this is a perfect place for a happy hour or for weekend drinks. The outdoor tables have fire places in the middle, so it does keep you warm during cooler nights.

data.title: Americanised British
data.text: Being a British expat it's nice to have somewhere local to be able to have some British food at hand. Saying that, the Red Fox is a very Americanised version of an English pub (pub being dark and dingy). Growing up in the UK I never ever saw pretzels on a pub menu (or any menu for that matter) - maybe i'm being too picky about what I really know as being an English pub. Food wise, it's tasty - the drinks too - a great selection there and a great touch of appearing to serve chips in newspaper.

data.title: BIRTHDAY CELEBRATION
data.text: This is great  Irish pub to share great conversation and watch the games.  There is an outdoor sitting on the rooftop. Fire pits and heaters are there. Comfy seating at tables or romantic on the sofa.  The food was fantastic. We had the dumplings which was so mouthwatering. The variety of beers is overwhelming but the sample taste was nice before ordering one. The staff is fantastic. Ask for Paul for your server he was remarkable..My sister-in-law and I celebrated our birthday and really enjoyed the eve
